item.title: Quantifying Variance in Evaluation Benchmarks
item.description: paper-notes By Lovish, paper done with Dieuwke Hupkes at Meta. Paper This paper cautions against using IRT to reduce variance.

item.title: Fluid Language model benchmarking
item.description: Blog post Paper From Ai2 benchmarking paper-notes evaluation, COLM 2025 Motivation Item response theory: a test question is most informative when its tailored to the capabilities of the student.

item.title: 2025-09-17 Reading
item.description: We’re in the Windows 95 Era of AI Agent Security MS pivoted from a universal backwards compatibility ethos up to Win95 to a “security over features” mindset with Windows NT Flexibility as a downfall of security 14 attacks on Gemini shown at Black Hat Cybersecurity conf.

item.title: Mental health supervisory agents
item.description: paperidea paper-ideas Can we build a system that reviews logs of individual interactions with a chatbot to identify problematic patterns, spirals in behavior, etc? Many cases of people having mental health spirals and relationship collapse following heavy chatgpt use have been documented.

item.title: Design moodboard
item.description: coloring antiwork.com Generates color scheme automatically fonts I really like the way she used Futura here, and the yellow font with the slight drop shadow reads well over the rest Openai logo exploration x.com/areatechnology_/status/1968342839542350119 So y2k so aesthetic so sex .

item.title: Lessons from the trenches in AI agent evaluation
item.description: textvomit Transcription of post by Sayash Kapoor 1. High evaluation costs prevent uncertainty estimation.

item.title: Blogpost idea suggestibility machines
item.description: blog-idea Claude opus threatened to blackmail the engineer, given the context that it had blackmailable information on the engineer, and that it would be shut down Does the model really have an urge for self-preservation or is this just the most obvious way a story would follow? Does it matter?.

item.title: abstracts for talks
item.description: defense A fundamental open question in AI research is: “how can we confidently know what a model can reliably do?” Currently, we often discover model limitations through post-deployment failures rather than proactive assessment.

item.title: Doctoral degree filing checklist
item.description: Verify no incompletes in GOLD ✅ 2025-06-09 Verify committee on file ✅ 2025-06-09 Copyright permissions ✅ 2025-06-09 ProQuest account ✅ 2025-06-09 Electronic submission of dissertation on proquest ✅ 2025-06-10 Signed forms sent to gradacademics@graddiv.ucsb.
